alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 3:54AM MST until December 25 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MOUNTAINS TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...Winter conditions for the I-80 Summit, Buford and Vedauwoo this Morning... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total new snow accumulations of 10 to 14 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range in southeast Wyoming. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this evening through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snow mobilers likely to become disoriented and lost with very poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
